session_info.title: Peaceful Evening Wind-Down
session_info.description: Gentle sequence to release the day's tension and prepare mind and body for restful sleep

preparation.environment: Dim lighting, quiet space, comfortable temperature
preparation.mindset: Give yourself permission to let go of the day completely
optional_additions: Soft background music or nature sounds

sequence.purpose: Consciously shift from day mode to evening mode

activities.name: Three Cleansing Breaths
activities.instructions: Take three deep breaths. With each exhale, consciously release the energy and concerns of the day. Imagine breathing out stress and breathing in peace.
activities.breathing: Inhale deeply through nose, pause, exhale completely through mouth
activities.purpose: Signal to nervous system that it's time to unwind

activities.name: Gratitude & Intention Setting
activities.instructions: Place hand on heart. Think of three things from your day you're grateful for. Set intention to rest peacefully and wake refreshed.
activities.benefits: Shifts focus from stress to appreciation, promotes positive sleep thoughts

sequence.purpose: Release physical tension accumulated throughout the day

poses.name: Seated Side Bend
poses.instructions: Sit cross-legged or in chair. Reach right arm overhead and lean gently to the left, breathing into the right side. Hold and breathe, then switch sides.
poses.breathing: 5 deep breaths each side, feeling expansion on the stretched side
poses.benefits: Releases tension in side body, opens ribs for deeper breathing

poses.name: Seated Gentle Twist
poses.instructions: Place right hand behind you, left hand on right knee. Gently twist spine to the right, looking over right shoulder. Hold and breathe, then switch.
poses.breathing: Deepen twist slightly on each exhale
poses.benefits: Releases lower back tension, aids digestion

poses.name: Tabletop Hip Circles
poses.instructions: Come to hands and knees. Slowly circle hips in both directions, moving with your breath and finding areas of tightness to gently release.
poses.breathing: Match movement to breath, exhale as you find tight spots
poses.benefits: Releases hip tension from sitting, prepares body for rest

sequence.purpose: Deeply calm nervous system and prepare for sleep

poses.name: Supported Child's Pose
poses.instructions: Knees wide, big toes touching. If available, place pillow or bolster lengthwise and rest torso on it. Turn head to one side, switch halfway through.
poses.breathing: Long, slow breaths, feeling completely supported and safe
poses.benefits: Calms nervous system, relieves lower back, feeling of being held
poses.modifications: Use folded blanket instead of pillow, or sit back on heels

poses.name: Legs Up the Wall or Chair
poses.instructions: Lie on back with legs up against wall, or feet up on chair or couch. Arms rest by sides, palms up. Close eyes and surrender completely.
poses.breathing: Natural breath, focus on feeling of legs draining and heart calming
poses.benefits: Reduces swelling in legs, calms mind, gentle inversion effect
poses.modifications: Use pillows under lower back for comfort

sequence.purpose: Complete the transition to sleep readiness

practice.name: Progressive Muscle Release
instructions: Lie comfortably and close your eyes
Starting with your toes, consciously relax each part of your body
Move up through legs, hips, belly, chest, arms, shoulders, neck, face
With each body part, think 'let go' and feel it melting into relaxation
End by relaxing your mind, letting thoughts slow and fade
practice.benefits: Systematic relaxation ensures no tension remains in the body

sleep_transition.bedtime_routine: Continue this peaceful feeling as you prepare for bed
sleep_transition.final_thoughts: If worries arise, acknowledge them and set them aside for tomorrow
sleep_transition.breathing: Continue slow, gentle breathing as you fall asleep
sleep_transition.affirmation: I release this day with gratitude and welcome peaceful rest

troubleshooting.racing_mind: Focus on the physical sensations of relaxation rather than trying to stop thoughts
troubleshooting.physical_discomfort: Adjust position as needed - comfort is more important than 'perfect' form
troubleshooting.time_constraints: Even 5 minutes of this practice is beneficial - adapt to your schedule

daily_tips: Consistency matters more than duration - even 5 minutes helps
Create a tech-free bedroom environment for better sleep
Keep the room cool and dark for optimal sleep conditions
This practice becomes more effective with repetition - be patient with yourself
